parameters.name: urn
parameters.description: Indicates the string returned by the server that identifies a version of resource.

parameters.name: id.project
parameters.description: Name of the project the resource belongs to.

parameters.name: id.domain
parameters.description:
Name of the domain the resource belongs to.
A domain can be considered as a subset within a specific project.
+optional - in certain contexts - like 'List API'

parameters.name: id.name
parameters.description:
User provided value for the resource.
The combination of project + domain + name uniquely identifies the resource.
+optional - in certain contexts - like 'List API', 'Launch plans'.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Indicates the number of resources to be returned.
+optional.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Indicates the offset to fetch the resource from.
Pagination support provided by the endpoint returns an offset for the next page.
+optional.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Indicates a list of filters passed as string.
More info on constructing filters : <Link>
+optional.

+optional - in certain contexts - like 'List API'

+optional.

+optional.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Name of the project that contains the identifiers.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description:
Name of the domain the identifiers belongs to within the project.
+optional

parameters.name: project

Name of the domain the identifiers belongs to within the project.
+optional

parameters.name: urn
parameters.description: Indicates the string returned by the server that identifies a version of resource.

parameters.name: urn
parameters.description: Indicates the string returned by the server that identifies a version of resource.

ComparisonExpressionOperator.description:
- GT: Greater Than
 - LT: Less Than
ComparisonExpressionOperator.title: Binary Operator for each expression

ConjunctionExpressionLogicalOperator.title:
Nested conditions. They can be conjoined using AND / OR
Order of evaluation is not important as the operators are Commutative

value.description: Value must be a valid k8s quantity.

ResourcesResourceEntry.description: Encapsulates a resource name and value.

name.title: A unique name -within the schema type- for the column

type.description: The column type. This allows a limited set of types currently.

principal.description: Identifier of the entity that triggered this execution.

nesting.description:
Indicates the "nestedness" of this execution.
If a user launches a workflow execution, the default nesting is 0.
If this execution further launches a workflow (child workflow), the nesting level is incremented by 0 => 1
Generally, if workflow at nesting level k launches a workflow then the child workflow will have
nesting = k + 1.

adminExecutionPhase.description: Indicates various phases of an Execution for both node and launch plan.

launch_plan_urn.title: Launch plan urn to be executed

inputs.title: Input values to be passed for the execution

notifications.title: List of notifications based on Execution status transitions

project.description: Name of the project the resource belongs to.

domain.title:
Name of the domain the resource belongs to.
A domain can be considered as a subset within a specific project.
+optional - in certain contexts - like 'List API'

name.title:
User provided value for the resource.
The combination of project + domain + name uniquely identifies the resource.
+optional - in certain contexts - like 'List API', 'Launch plans'

adminIdentifier.description:
Encapsulation of fields that identifies a Flyte resource.
A resource can internally have multiple versions.

expected_inputs.title: Indicates the set of inputs to execute the Launch plan

expected_outputs.title: Indicates the set of outputs from the Launch plan

schedule.title: Schedule to execute the Launch Plan

notifications.title: List of notifications based on Execution status transitions

workflow_urn.title: Reference to the Workflow template that the launch plan references

default_inputs.title: Input values to be passed for the execution

fixed_inputs.title: Fixed, non overridable inputs for the Launch Plan

adminLaunchPlanState.title: Indicates various states of an Execution - both task and workflow

phases.description: A list of phases to which users can associate the notifications to.

adminNotification.description: Represents a structure for notifications based on execution status.

id.description: id represents the unique identifier of the task.

version.description:
Indicates a particular of version of the task.
A task uniquely referenced by id can have multiple versions.

urn.description:
Represents the string that uniquely identifies a revision of a task.
Identifier and version together also uniquely identifies a task revision.

closure.description: closure encapsulates all the fields that maps to a compiled version of the task.

adminTask.title: Represents the task structure stored in the Admin

compiled_task.description: Represents the compiled representation of the task from the specification provided.

adminTaskClosure.description: Represents an encapsulation of the task compilation.

id.description: id represents the unique identifier of the task.

version.description:
Indicates a particular of version of the task.
A task uniquely referenced by id can have multiple versions.

adminTaskCreateRequest.description: Represents a request structure to create a revision of a task.

urn.description:
Represents the string that uniquely identifies a revision of a task.
Identifier and version together also uniquely identifies a task revision.

adminTaskCreateResponse.description: Represents a response structure if task creation succeeds.

tasks.description: A list of tasks returned based on the request.

offset.description:
Offset value indicates if more results are available.
Value of -1, indicates no more page available.

adminTaskList.description: Represents a list of tasks returned from the admin.

template.description: Template of the task that encapsulates all the metadata of the task.

adminTaskSpec.description: Represents a structure that encapsulates the specification of the task.

id.description: id represents the unique identifier of the workflow.

version.description:
Indicates a particular of version of the workflow.
A workflow uniquely referenced by id can have multiple versions.

urn.description:
Represents the string that uniquely identifies a revision of a workflow.
Identifier and version together also uniquely identifies a workflow revision.

closure.description: closure encapsulates all the fields that maps to a compiled version of the workflow.

adminWorkflow.title: Represents the workflow structure stored in the Admin

compiled_workflow.description: Represents the compiled representation of the workflow from the specification provided.

adminWorkflowClosure.description: Represents an encapsulation of the workflow compilation.

id.description: id represents the unique identifier of the workflow.

version.description:
Indicates a particular of version of the workflow.
A workflow uniquely referenced by id can have multiple versions.

adminWorkflowCreateRequest.description: Represents a request structure to create a revision of a workflow.

urn.description:
Represents the string that uniquely identifies a revision of a workflow.
Identifier and version together also uniquely identifies a workflow revision.

adminWorkflowCreateResponse.description: Represents a response structure if workflow creation succeeds.

workflows.description: A list of workflows returned based on the request.

offset.description:
Offset value indicates if more results are available.
Value of -1 indicates no more page available.

adminWorkflowList.description: Represents a list of workflows returned from the admin.

template.description: Template of the task that encapsulates all the metadata of the workflow.

adminWorkflowSpec.description: Represents a structure that encapsulates the specification of the workflow.

var.description: Must match one of the output variable names on a node.

alias.description: A workflow-level unique alias that downstream nodes can refer to in their input.

coreAlias.description: Links a variable to an alias.

coreBinary.description:
A simple byte array with a tag to help different parts of the system communicate about what is in the byte array.
It's strongly advisable that consumers of this type define a unique tag and validate the tag before parsing the data.

var.description: Variable name must match an input/output variable of the node.

binding.description: Data to use to bind this variable.

coreBinding.description: An input/output binding of a variable to either static value or a node output.

collection.description:
A collection of binding data. This allows nesting of binding data to any number
of levels.

promise.description: References an output promised by another node.

map.description: A map of bindings. The key is always a string.

coreBindingData.description: Specifies either a simple value or a reference to another output.

coreBlob.description:
Refers to an offloaded set of files. It encapsulates the type of the store and a unique uri for where the data is.
There are no restrictions on how the uri is formatted since it will depend on how to interact with the store.

format.title:
Format can be a free form string understood by SDK/UI etc like
csv, parquet etc

coreBooleanExpression.description:
Defines a boolean expression tree. It can be a simple or a conjunction expression.
Multiple expressions can be combined using a conjunction or a disjuntion to result in final boolean result.

coreBranchNode.description:
BranchNode is a special node that alter the flow of the workflow graph. It allows the control flow to branch at
runtime based on a series of conditions that get evaluated on various parameters (e.g. inputs, primtives).

coreComparisonExpression.description:
Defines a 2-level tree where the root is a comparison operator and Operands are primtivies or known variables.
Each expression results in a boolean result.

coreCompiledTask.title: Output of the Compilation step. This object represent one Task. We store more metadata at this layer

connections.description: For internal use only! This field is used by the system and must not be filled in. Any values set will be ignored.

coreCompiledWorkflow.title: Output of the compilation Step. This object represents one workflow. We store more metadata at this layer

sub_workflows.title:
Guaranteed that there will only exist one and only one workflow with a given id, i.e., every sub workflow has a
unique identifier. Also every enclosed subworkflow is used either by a primary workflow or by a subworkflow
as an inlined workflow
+optional

tasks.title:
Guaranteed that there will only exist one and only one task with a given id, i.e., every task has a unique id
+required (atleast 1)

coreCompiledWorkflowClosure.description:
A Compiled Workflow Closure contains all the information required to start a new execution, or to visualized a workflow
and its details. The CompiledWorkflowClosure should always contain a primary workflow, that is the main workflow that
will being the execution. All subworkflows are denormalized. WorkflowNodes refer the the workflow names of compiled
subworkflows.

coreConjunctionExpression.description: Defines a conjunction expression of two boolean expressions.

downstream.title: A list of all the node ids that are downstream from a given node id

upstream.title: A list of all the node ids, that are upstream of this node id

coreConnectionSet.title:
Adjacency list for the workflow. This is created as part of the compilation process. Every process after the compilation
step uses this created ConnectionSet

command.description: Command to be executed, if not provided, the default entrypoint in the container image will be used.

args.description:
These will default to Flyte given paths. If provided, the system will not append known paths. If the task still
needs flyte's inputs and outputs path, add $(FLYTE_INPUT_FILE), $(FLYTE_OUTPUT_FILE) wherever makes sense and the
system will populate these before executing the container.

resources.description: Container resources requirement as specified by the container engine.

env.description: Environment variables will be set as the container is starting up.

config.description:
Allows extra configs to be available for the container.
TODO: elaborate on how configs will become available.

coreIfBlock.description: Defines a condition and the execution unit that should be executed if the condition is satisfied.

else_node.description: The node to execute in case non of the branches were taken.

error.description: An error to throw in case non of the branches were taken.

coreIfElseBlock.description:
Defines a series of if/else blocks. The first branch whose condition evaluates to true is the one to execute.
If no conditions were satisfied, the else_node will be executed.

collection.description: A collection of literals to allow nesting.

map.description: A map of strings to literals.

coreLiteral.description: A simple value. This supports any level of nesting (e.g. array of array of array of Blobs) as well as simple primitives.

coreLiteralCollection.description: A collection of literals. This is a workaround since oneofs in proto messages cannot contain a repeated field.

coreLiteralMap.description: A map of literals. This is a workaround since oneofs in proto messages cannot contain a repeated field.

simple.description: A simple type that can be compared one-to-one with another.

schema.description: A complex type that requires matching of inner fields.

collection_type.description: Defines the type of the value of a collection. Only homogeneous collections are allowed.

map_value_type.description: Defines the type of the value of a map type. The type of the key is always a string.

coreLiteralType.description: Defines a strong type to allow type checking between interfaces.

id.description:
A workflow-level unique identifier that identifies this node in the workflow. "inputs" and "outputs" are reserved
node ids that cannot be used by other nodes.

inputs.description:
Specifies how to bind the underlying interface's inputs. All required inputs specified in the underlying interface
must be fullfilled.

upstream_node_ids.description:
+optional Specifies execution depdendency for this node ensuring it will only get scheduled to run after all its
upstream nodes have completed. This node will have an implicit depdendency on any node that appears in inputs
field.

output_aliases.description:
+optional. A node can define aliases for a subset of its outputs. This is particularly useful if different nodes
need to conform to the same interface (e.g. all branches in a branch node). Downstream nodes must refer to this
nodes outputs using the alias if one's specified.

task_node.description: Information about the Task to execute in this node.

workflow_node.description: Information about the Workflow to execute in this mode.

branch_node.description: Information about the branch node to evaluate in this node.

coreNode.description:
A Workflow graph Node. One unit of execution in the graph. Each node can be linked to a Task, a Workflow or a branch
node.

name.title: A friendly name for the Node

timeout.description: The overall timeout of a task.

coreNodeMetadata.description: Defines extra information about the Node.

var.title: Or one of this node's input variables

coreOperand.description: Defines an operand to a comparison expression.

node_id.description: Node id must exist at the graph layer.

var.description: Variable name must refer to an output variable for the node.

coreOutputReference.description:
A reference to an output produced by a node. The type can be retrieved -and validated- from
the underlying interface of the node.

var.description: +required Variable. Defines a name and a type to reference/compare through out the system.

default.description: Defines a default value that has to match the variable type defined.

required.description: +optional, is this value required to be filled.

requests.description: The desired set of resources requested.

limits.description: Defines a set of bounds (e.g. min/max) within which the task can reliably run.

coreResources.description:
A customizable interface to convey resources requested for a container. This can be interpretted differently for different
container engines.

retries.description:
Number of retries. Retries will be consumed when the job fails with a recoverable error.
The number of retries must be less than or equals to 10.

coreRetryStrategy.description: Retry strategy associated with an executable unit.

version.description:
Version of the runtime. All versions should be backward compatible. However, certain cases call for version
checks to ensure tighter validation or setting expectations.

flavor.description: +optional It can be used to provide extra information about the runtime (e.g. python, golang... etc.).

coreRuntimeMetadata.description: Runtime information. This is losely defined to allow for extensibility.

coreSchema.description: A strongly typed schema that defines the interface of data retrieved from the underlying storage medium.

columns.description: A list of ordered columns this schema comprises of.

coreSchemaType.description: Defines schema columns and types to strongly type-validate schemas interoperability.

coreSimpleType.description: Define a set of simple types.

coreTaskCategory.title:
- SingleStepTask: Task category that identifies if the system can use default structures in UI, etc to drive the task
TODO should we add Container type of tasks as a special Class?

discoverable.description: Indicates whether the system should attempt to lookup this task's output to avoid duplication of work.

timeout.description: The overall timeout of a task.

reference_id.description: A globally unique identifier for the task.

coreTaskNode.description: Refers to the task that the Node is to execute.

id.description: Auto generated taskId by the system. Task Id uniquely identifies this task globally.

category.title: Category of the task. These are predefined and help provide defaults

type.description:
A predefined yet extensible Task type identifier. This can be used to customize any of the components. If no
extensions are provided in the system, Flyte will resolve the this task to its TaskCategory and default the
implementation registered for the TaskCategory.

interface.description:
A strongly typed interface for the task. This enables others to use this task within a workflow and gauarantees
compile-time validation of the workflow to avoid costly runtime failures.

custom.description: Custom data about the task. This is extensible to allow various plugins in the system.

coreTaskTemplate.description:
A Task structure that uniquely identifies a task in the system
Tasks are registered as a first step in the system.

coreTypedInterface.description: Defines strongly typed inputs and outputs.

coreWaitable.description:
Defines an execution unit recognized by the system and can be referred to by other units to listen to its execution
events (started, succeeded, aborted... etc.).

launchplan_ref.description: A globally unique identifier for the launch plan.

sub_workflow_ref.title: Reference to a subworkflow, that should be defined with the compiler context

coreWorkflowNode.description: Refers to a the workflow the node is to execute.

id.description: This is an autogenerated id by the system. The id is globally unique across the system.

interface.description: Defines a strongly typed interface for the Workflow. This can include some optional parameters.

nodes.description: A list of nodes. In addition, "globals" is a special reserved node id that can be used to consume workflow inputs.

outputs.description:
A list of output bindings that specify how to construct workflow outputs. Bindings can pull node outputs or
specify literals. All workflow outputs specified in the interface field must be bound in order for the workflow
to be validated. A workflow has an implicit depdendency on all of its nodes to execute successfully in order to
bind final outputs.

failure_node.description:
+optional A catch-all node. This node is executed whenever the execution engine determines the workflow has failed.
The interface of this node must match the Workflow interface with an additional input named "error" of type
pb.lyft.flyte.core.Error.

coreWorkflowTemplate.description:
Flyte Workflow Structure that encapsulates task, branch and subworkflow nodes to form a statically analyzable,
directed acyclic graph.

failed_node_id.description: The node id that threw the error.

flyteidlcoreError.description: Represents an error thrown from a node.
